name: 邱家吉
objective: This is the first course in numerical analysis for graduate students. The objectives of the course include: (1) Development and applications of numerical methods when analytical techniques are not available; (2) Numerical differentiation and integration; (3) Numerical solution of ODEs and PDEs; (4) To get familiar with different types of commercial software.
schedule:
Week 1 Introduction and some useful software
Week 2 Introduction and installation of python
Week 3 Interpolation
Week 4 Numerical differentiation
Week 5 Numerical integration
Week 6 Numerical solution of ODEs
Week 7 (4/2 holiday)
Week 8 Numerical solution of ODEs
Week 9 Numerical solution of PDEs
Week 10 Numerical solution of PDEs
Week 11 Numerical solution of PDEs
Week 12 Discrete element method: PFC
Week 13 Presentation and discussion of PFC
Week 14 Discrete element method: UDEC
Week 15 Presentation and discussion of UDEC
Week 16 Finite difference method: FLAC
Week 17 Presentation and discussion of FLAC
Week 18 Project submission
materials: Parviz Moin (2010), Fundamentals of engineering numerical analysis, second edition. Cambridge University press.
